title: Trump offers to broker ceasefire between Turkish and Kurds as US sidelined in Syria
text:
Donald Trump has launched a diplomatic effort to broker a ceasefire between Turkey and Kurdish forces after more than a week of US inaction in which hundreds have been killed and thousands displaced in northeast Syria.

Mr Trump spoke by phone to both Recep Tayyip Erdoğan, Turkey’s president, and the head of the Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) on Tuesday and called for a halt to the Turkish offensive in Syria.

“President Trump communicated to [Mr Erdoğan] very clearly that the US wants Turkey to stop the invasion, implement an immediate ceasefire, and begin to negotiate with Kurdish forces in Syria,” Mr Pence said.

Mr Pence said he would travel to Turkey at the head of a US delegation to try broker an agreement. Earlier on Monday, the US imposed sanctions on Turkey’s defence and interior ministers in an effort to put pressure on Ankara.

Mr Trump’s lurch into action came eight days after he appeared to greenlight Turkey’s invasion of northern Syria by telling Mr Erdoğan that US forces would move aside and allow Turkish troops into the region.
